meanings.definition: The act of serving as a dean.
meanings.sent1: Her deaning involved making decisions for the school.
meanings.sent2: The deaning was a crucial responsibility in the university.
meanings.sent3: The deaning had to juggle various tasks to keep the school running smoothly.
meanings.sent4: In the world of education, deaning is like being the captain of a ship.
meanings.sent5: The deaning required strong leadership skills and organization.

meanings.definition: The process of overseeing academic affairs as a dean.
meanings.sent1: During deaning, he ensured all departments were functioning well.
meanings.sent2: Effective deaning requires attention to detail and communication.
meanings.sent3: The deaning had to deal with a sudden influx of student requests.
meanings.sent4: In the realm of academia, deaning is akin to conducting a symphony.
meanings.sent5: The deaning involved coordinating schedules and resolving conflicts.

meanings.definition: The role or position of a dean.
meanings.sent1: Her deaning as the head of the department was challenging but rewarding.
meanings.sent2: The deaning required a deep understanding of educational policies.
meanings.sent3: The deaning was often filled with meetings and paperwork.
meanings.sent4: In the hierarchy of the university, deaning is like being a chief executive officer.
meanings.sent5: The deaning involved representing the institution at various events.
